label: Birth Certificate Number
description: Birth Certificate Number (only unique per year)

label: Birth Certificate Year
description: The infant's birth certificate year in which the date of birth occured.

label: Child's Birth Date
description: The infant's date of birth.

label: Child's Birth Time
description: The infant's time of birth. (3-4 digit integer for hours and minutes)

label: Birth State
description: The name of the State (USA) where the birth occurred. (NV)

label: Birth Day
description: Birth Day (1-31)

label: Birth Month
description: Birth Month (1-12)

label: Birth Year
description: Birth Year (4-digit)

label: Antisepis
description: Any antibacterial drug (penicillin, ampicillin, gentamicin, cefotoxine, etc.) given systemically (intravenous or intramuscular). Does not include antibiotics given to infants who are NOT suspected of having neonatal sepsis.

label: Birth Injury
description: Skeletal fracture(s), peripheral nerve injury, and/or soft tissue or solid organ hemorrhage that requires intervention. Present immediately following or soon after delivery. Includes any bony fracture or weakness or loss of sensation, but excludes fractured clavicles and transient facial nerve palsy.Includes any bony fracture or weakness or loss of sensation, but excludes fractured clavicles and transient facial nerve palsy. Soft tissue hemorrhage requiring evaluation and/or treatment, includes subgaleal (progressive extravasation within the scalp) hemorrhage, giant cephalohematoma, extensive truncal, facial and/or extremity ecchymosis accompanied by evidence of anemia and/or hypovolemia and/or hypotension. Solid organ hemorrhage includes subcapsular hematoma of the liver, fractures of the spleen, or adrenal hematoma.

label: Admitted to NICU
description: Admission into a facility or unit staffed and equipped to provide continuous mechanical ventilatory support for a newborn.

label: Seizures
description: Seizure - any involuntary repetitive, convulsive movement or behavior. Serious neurologic dysfunction - severe alteration of alertness.  Excludes: - Lethargy or hypotonia in the absence of other neurologic findings - Symptoms associated with CNS congenital anomalies.

label: Surfactant
description: Endotracheal instillation of a surface-active suspension for treating surfactant deficiency due to preterm birth or pulmonary injury resulting in respiratory distress. Includes both artificial and extracted natural surfactant.

label: Assisted Ventilation < 30 Min
description: Infant given manual breaths for any duration with bag and mask or bag and endotracheal tube within the first several minutes from birth. Excludes free flow oxygen only, laryngoscopy for aspiration of meconium and nasal cannula.

label: Assisted Ventilation >= 30 Min
description: Infant given mechanical ventilation (breathing assistance) by any method for more than 30 minutes.  Includes conventional, high frequency and/or continuous positive pressure (CPAP). Excludes free flow oxygen only, laryngoscopy for aspiration of meconium and nasal cannula.

label: Anecephalus
description: Partial or complete absence of the brain and skull. Also called anencephalus, acrania, or absent brain. Also includes infants with craniorachischisis (anencephaly with a contiguous spine defect).

label: Other Chromosomal Anomalies
description: Includes any constellation of congenital malformations resulting from or compatible with known syndromes caused by detectable defects in chromosome structure. Karyotype confirmed, Karyotype pending

label: Cleft Lip
description: Incomplete closure of the lip. May be unilateral, bilateral, or median.

label: Cleft Palate
description: Incomplete fusion of the palatal shelves. May be limited to the soft palate or may extend into the hard palate. Cleft palate in the presence of cleft lip should be included in the category above.

label: Diaphragmatic Hernia
description: Defect in the formation of the diaphragm allowing herniation of abdominal organs into the thoracic cavity.

label: Downs Syndrome
description: Trisomy 21 Karyotype confirmed,  Karyotype pending

label: Gastroschisis
description: An abnormality of the anterior abdominal wall, lateral to the umbilicus, resulting in herniation of the abdominal contents directly into the amniotic cavity. Differentiated from omphalocele by the location of the defect and the absence of a protective membrane.

label: Heart Disease
description: Congenital heart defects that cause cyanosis.

label: Hypospadias
description: Incomplete closure of the male urethra resulting in the urethral meatus opening on the ventral surface of the penis. Includes: - First degree (on the glans ventral to the tip) - Second degree (in the coronal sulcus) - Third degree (on the penile shaft)

label: Limb Reduction
description: Excluding congenital amputation and dwarfing syndromes, this is a complete or partial absence of a portion of an extremity, secondary to failure to develop.

label: Omphalacele
description: A defect in the anterior abdominal wall, accompanied by herniation of some abdominal organs through a widened umbilical ring into the umbilical stalk. The defect is covered by a membrane (different from gastroschisis [see below]), although this sac may rupture. Also called exomphalos. Do not include umbilical hernia (completely covered by skin) in this category. Do not include Spina bifida occulta (a midline bony spinal defect without protrusion of the spinal cord or meninges).

label: Spina Bifida / Meningocele
description: Spina bifida is herniation of the meninges and/or spinal cord tissue through a bony defect of spine closure. Meningomyelocele is herniation of meninges and spinal cord tissue. Meningocele (herniation of meninges without spinal cord tissue) should also be included in this category. Both open and closed (covered with skin) lesions should be included. Do not include Spina bifida occulta (a midline bony spinal defect without protrusion of the spinal cord or meninges).

label: APGAR 10 Score
description: A systematic measure for evaluating the physical condition of the infant at specific intervals following birth.

label: APGAR 5 Score
description: A systematic measure for evaluating the physical condition of the infant at specific intervals following birth.
Not used. All NULL.
Unclear. Most are 88.

label: Birth Order
description: The order born in the delivery, live born or fetal death (1st, 2nd, 3rd, 4th, 5th, 6th, 7th, etc.).

label: Birth Route
description: Vaginal/spontaneous - Delivery of the entire fetus through the vagina by the natural force of labor with or without manual assistance from the delivery attendant. Vaginal/forceps - Delivery of the fetal head through the vagina by the application of obstetrical forceps to the fetal head. Vaginal/vacuum - Delivery of the fetal head through the vagina by the application of a vacuum cup or ventouse to the fetal head. Cesarean - Extraction of the fetus, placenta, and membranes through an incision in the maternal abdominal and uterine walls.

label: Child's Birth Weight
description: Child's Birth Weight (Integer lbs Only 0-13)

label: Child's Birth Weight in Ounces
description: Child's Birth Weight (Integer Ounces Only 0-15)

label: Birth Weight in Grams
description: Birth Weight in Grams (300-6149)

label: Grams or Pounds
description: Birth Weight Unit in Grams or Pounds (grams and lbs/oz fields all exist)

label: Birth Weight Group
description: Baby's birthweight group- normal, low, or very low weight.

label: Antibiotics during labor and delivery?
description: Includes antibacterial medications given systemically (intravenous or intramuscular) to the mother in the interval between the onset of labor and the actual delivery. Includes: Ampicillin Penicillin Clindamycin Erythromycin Gentamicin Cefataxine Ceftriaxone

label: Delivery augmentation (use of pitocin)?
description: Stimulation of uterine contractions by drug or manipulative technique with the intent to reduce the time of delivery (i.e., after labor has begun).

label: Chorioamnionitis (maternal infection)?
description: Clinical diagnosis of chorioamnionitis during labor made by the delivery attendant. Usually includes more than one of the following: fever, uterine tenderness and/or irritability, leukocytosis, or fetal tachycardia. Any recorded maternal temperature at or above 38C (100.4F).

label: epidermal anaesthesia??
description: Administration to the mother of a regional anesthetic to control the pain of labor. Delivery of the agent into a limited space with the distribution of the analgesic effect limited to the lower body.

label: Fetal intolerance?
description: In-utero resuscitative measures, further fetal assessment, or operative delivery. Includes any of the following: - Maternal position change - Oxygen administration to the mother - Intravenous fluids administered to the mother - Amnioinfusion - Support of maternal blood pressure - Administration of uterine relaxing agents Further fetal assessment including any of the following: scalp pH, scalp stimulation, acoustic stimulation. Operative delivery to shorten time to delivery of the fetus such as forceps, vacuum, or cesarean delivery.

label: Induced labor
description: Initiation of uterine contractions by medical and/or surgical means for the purpose of delivery before the spontaneous onset of labor (i.e., before labor has begun).

label: Meconium Moderate/Heavy
description: Staining of the amniotic fluid caused by passage of fetal bowel contents during labor and/or at delivery that is more than enough to cause a greenish color change of an otherwise clear fluid.

label: None vertex (may be breech or other)?
Use of steroids during labor?
description: Steroids (glucocorticoids) for fetal lung maturation received by the mother before delivery. Includes: betamethasone, dexamethasone, or hydrocortisone specifically given to accelerate fetal lung maturation in anticipation of preterm delivery. Does not include steroid medication given to the mother as an antiinflammatory treatment before or after delivery.

label: Birth Facility
description: The name of the facility where the delivery took place.

label: Total Gestation Duration in Days
description: Total Gestation Duration in Days (140-301)

label: Total Estimated Gestation Duration in Weeks
description: Total Estimated Gestation Duration in Weeks (20-43)

label: Total Gestation Duration in Weeks
description: Total Gestation Duration in Weeks (20-43,99)

label: Infant exposed to  chlamydia
description: A positive test for Chlamydia trachomatis.

label: Infant exposed to cytomegalvirus
description: A diagnosis of or positive test for Cytomegalovirus. * Applicable to fetal deaths only.

label: Infant exposed to genital herpes
description: A diganosis or positive test for genital herpes

label: Infant exposed to gonorrhea
description: A positive test/culture for Neisseria gonorrhoeae.

label: Infant explosed to hepatitis B
description: A positive test for the hepatitis B virus.

label: Infant exposed to Hepatitis C
description: A positive test for the hepatitis C virus.

label: Infant exposed to HIV/AIDS
description: A diganosis or positive test for HIV/AIDS

label: Infant exposed to Human papilloma virus
description: A diganosis or positive test for HPV

label: Infant exposed to other infection
description: A diganosis or positive test for other disease

label: Infant exposed to rubella
description: A diganosis or positive test for rubella

label: Infant exposed to syphillis
description: A positive test for Treponema pallidum.

label: Infant exposed to toxoplasmosis
description: A diagnosis of or positive test for Toxoplasma gondii. * Applicable to fetal deaths only.

label: Infant transfused
description: Transfer status of the infant within 24 hours after delivery.

label: Infant exposed to tuberculosis
description: A diganosis or positive test for tuberculosis

label: Previous Live Births that died???
description: The total number of previous live born infants now dead.

label: Previous Live Births still living???
description: The total number of previous live born infants now living.

label: Last Menses Date
description: The date the mother's last normal menstrual period began. This item is used to compute the gestational age of the infant.

label: Maternal hysterotomy
description: Surgical removal of the uterus that was not planned before the admission. Includes an anticipated, but not definitively planned, hysterectomy.

label: Maternal ICU admission
description: Any admission, planned or unplanned, of the mother to a facility or unit designated as providing intensive care.

label: Maternal perineum laceration
description: 3 degree laceration extends completely through the perineal skin, vaginal mucosa, perineal body, and anal sphincter.  4 degree laceration is all of the above with extension through the rectal mucosa.

label: Maternal ruptured uterus
description: Tearing of the uterine wall.

label: Maternal transfusion
description: Includes infusion of whole blood or packed red blood cells associated with labor and delivery.

label: Unplanned Maternal Operation
description: Any transfer of the mother back to a surgical area for an operative procedure that was not planned before the admission for delivery.  Excludes postpartum tubal ligations.

label: Mother's Height in Feet
description: Mother's Height (Integer Feet Only)

label: Mother's Height in Inches
description: Mother's Height (Integer Inches Only)

label: Mother Transferred???
description: Transfers include hospital to hospital, birth facility to hospital, etc. Does not include home to hospital.

label: Maternal assisted reproduction
description: Any assisted reproductive technology (ART/technical procedures (e.g., IVF, GIFT, ZIFT)) used to initiate the pregnancy.

label: Eclampsia
description: Hypertension with proteinuria with generalized seizures or coma. May include pathologic edema.

label: Hypertension, Pregnancy Associated
description: Gestational Diagnosis in this pregnancy (Pregnancy induced hypertension, preeclampsia).

label: Hypertension
description: Elevation of blood pressure above normal for age, gender, and physiological condition.

label: Hypertension, Chronic
description: Prepregnancy (chronic) Diagnosis prior to the onset of this pregnancy-does not include gestational (pregnancy induced hypertension (PIH)

label: Infertility Drugs???
description: Any fertility enhancing drugs (e.g., Clomid, Pergonal), artificial insemination or intrauterine insemination used to initiate the pregnancy

label: Infertility Treatment???
description: Any assisted reproductive treatment used to initiate the pregnancy. Includes: - Drugs (such as Clomid, Pergonal) - Artificial insemination - Technical procedures (

label: Other Previous Poor Pregnancy Outcome
description: History of pregnancies continuing into the 20th week of gestation and resulting in any of the listed outcomes: - Perinatal death (including fetal and neonatal deaths) - Small for gestational age - Intrauterine-growth-restricted birth

label: Previous Preterm or Small for Gestational Age
description: History of pregnancy(ies) terminating in a live birth of less than 37 completed weeks of gestation.

label: Cervical Cerclage
description: Circumferential banding or suture of the cervix to prevent or treat passive dilation. Includes: MacDonald's suture, Shirodkar procedure, abdominal cerclage via laparotomy

label: Tocolysis
description: Administration of any agent with the intent to inhibit preterm uterine contractions to extend the length of the pregnancy. Medications: - Magnesium sulfate (for preterm labor) - Terbutaline - Indocin (for preterm labor)

label: Precipitous labor
description: Less than 3 hours

label: premature rupture of membranes
description: Prolonged, greater than or equal to 12 hours before the onset of labor.

label: prolonged labor defined as >XXX hours
description: Greater than or equal to 20 hours.

label: Delivery site
description: The type of place where the birth occurred; Hospital, Freestanding birthing center -  No direct physical connection with an operative delivery center, Home birth -  The birth occurred at a private residence, Clinic/Doctor's office, Other.

label: Number of Fetuses Delivered During This Pregnancy
description: The number of fetuses delivered live or dead at any time in the pregnancy regardless of gestational age, or if the fetuses were delivered at different dates in the pregnancy. 'Reabsorbed' fetuses (those that are not delivered: expulsed or extracted from the mother) should not be counted.

label: Prenatal Care Begin Date
description: The date a physician or other health care professional first examined and/or counseled the pregnant woman for the pregnancy.

label: Prenatal Care End Date
description: The month, day, and year of the last prenatal care visit recorded in the records.

label: Previous Live Birth Date
description: The date of birth of the last liveborn infant.

label: Principal source of payment
description: The principal source of payment at the time of delivery.

label: Child's Sex
description: The sex of the infant.

label: Total Prenatal Visit Count
description: The total number of visits recorded in the record.

label: Trial of Labor
description: Labor was allowed, augmented, or induced with plans for a vaginal delivery.
Not Used. All NULL.

label: Pre-pregnancy Weight
description: Pre-pregnancy Weight (In lbs 70 - 362, 999)

label: Mother's Delivery Weight?
description: The mother's weight at the time of delivery.
